name: K2-315
scenarioDescription:
The K2-315 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-315 is a star with 0.17 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.2 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-315 is known to have undefined exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-315 system


K2-315 b

K2-315 b was discovered by the undefined observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is NaN astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-315 b is 0.8077200000000001 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-315 b is 0.95 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, K2-315 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-315, which contains undefined planets and was discovered by undefined.
